page.title: 08Clay Pigeons at Cottesmore
page.content: On Sunday 23rd June John Davis, Mr.Hollis,Mr.Hodges,Mr.Joint, Mr.Rimmer and some other farmers and Andrew Hodges went Clay Pigeon Shooting down at crash gate no:6,on the airfield.Andrew and John were originally coming down the road to Glebe House but they saw that the farmers were shooting towards them. So they went back to Cottesmore and then to B-Hanger, and to crash gate no:6 and climbed over the fence. Mr.Hodges and Mr.Hollis were shooting.Andrew's score was 18/30,John's score was 17/30. A clay pigoen looks like a round disc and is made out of carbon dust. It has teeth on the outer side,to keep it from slipping when it's fired.When the shooting finished John and Andrew looked for used clays, they found three and some spent cartridges.
